page.title: 05MILE OAK
page.content: Mile Oak is a village on the A5 consisting of a farm,some isolated houses, a few small firms and an estate. The remaining land is mostly farmland. The industry comprises of a transport business (coaches, minibuses and taxis), a road haulage business and firm dealing in glues and gums. To the traveller on the A5, Mile Oak is a busy set of traffic lights with a garage on one corner and the Mile Oak pub on the opposite corner. This intersection between the A453 (Tamworth-Birmingham) and the A5 is an accident black spot. Big changes are in store for Mile Oak. A proposed A5 diversion to by-pass Fazeley, Two Gates and Wilnecote will leave the present course of the A5 here. A new hospital is also planned.
